title: What are some of the most important chemical compounds? - Quora

response.answer_text: Sulphuric acid.  It is a compound periodically cited as the criteria by which a nation's industrial development is assessed. I'll put some points to highlight why, It is used to make fertilizers. Not directly but it's use in making phosphoric acid is prominent which in turn is used to make phosphate fertilizers. This makes it of immense importance to agricultural nations like India. It's use in metallurgical processes is prominent. It is used directly in the extraction processes of copper and zinc. It is also used for cleaning the surface of zinc, a process known as “pickling”. It's use in making polymers. It's used to make caprolactum, which is the primary monomer for nylon-6. Other industrial productions. It's used in manufacture of Titanium Dioxide, hydrofluoric acid, phenol etc. All the products made with the help of sulphuric acid are of major industrial use and hence the association of industrial significance. Sources: Sulfuric acid Google images.

We are living in a world filled with chemical compounds, some of them being the most important things we use constantly. Here are a few of the thousands of compounds that are most useful in our daily routines: Water (H2O)Sodium Hydrogen Carbonate or Baking Soda (NaHCO3)Hydrogen Peroxide (H2O2)Sodium Nitrate (NaNO3Ammonia (NH3)Sucrose or Table Sugar (C12H22O11)
